page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Falkland is an extensive parish of more than 8000 acres.A quarter of which forms part of the Lomond Hills.The area is sparsely populated. The village of Falkland lies at the foot of the East Lomond Hill on the north side and enjoys a fairly mild and variable climate.The palace,in the Stuart period, was used as a hunting lodge and is now the main attraction for tourists. The village is occupied by papermill workers,with half a dozen large farms and many small farms in the near vicinity.Local shops cater for the tourist trade.Apart from that no other employment is available.Many people commute to Glenrothes or Cupar the nearest large centres of population. {
